review: Terrible game from the predatory corporation inhabiting the corpse of a once great developer.

you know how someone makes something alright, it's not perfect but servicable and then changes bit by bit to the point it's not the same thing you used to like? that's ow2 
also holy fuck the monetization is awful now, I'm fine with cosmetics being paid (a bit overpriced but whatever) but gameplay being locked behind a paywall (or hours long grindwall if you want to try out the new heroes)? cringe especially since the game wants you to counter pick

blizzard made a fun, 20$ team based shooter with a campaign with overwatch 1. You got free loot-boxes and skins and everything. Into a free game with a shit overpriced store and a battle pass, and now they're fucking drip feeding us content with the new pve that they promised for [b]free[/b] but its 15$. I wish i didn't get attached to this piece of crap.
The game is technically good blizzard sucks but the game at its core is fun thats all I care about
Anyone who plays this must loving sniffing copium and getting railed by Activision-Blizzard.
The game community is more toxic than the porn community. You don't need to play the game to enjoy overwatch porn.

I had been dumb enough to pay 20 bucks to buy another copy of Overwatch 1 for my wife (she doesn't like PvP gaming) so that we can play PvE in the distant future and also support the developer. Now the grand PvE content has been canceled and the existing BS costs another 15 dollars. What an idiot I was.

Ğ¯ Ğ½Ñ–ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¸ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ñ–ÑˆĞµ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ² Ñƒ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºÑƒ ÑĞ¼Ñ–Ñ‚Ñ‚Ñ”Ğ²Ñƒ Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ.

Overwatch 2 has not only met but exceeded every ounce of anticipation I held for it. As a die-hard fan of the original Overwatch, I approached this sequel with a mixture of excitement and caution. However, within moments of diving into the game, it became clear that Blizzard Entertainment had poured their heart and soul into crafting an experience that seamlessly marries the brilliance of its predecessor with innovative new elements.

First and foremost, the visual enhancements in Overwatch 2 are nothing short of breathtaking. The updated character models, meticulously detailed maps, and dynamic lighting transport players into a world that feels more alive and immersive than ever before. The character designs retain the iconic charm that made the original cast so endearing, while also introducing fresh faces that inject new life into the Overwatch universe.

The evolution of gameplay mechanics is where Overwatch 2 truly shines. The introduction of the new Push mode, alongside the familiar Escort, Assault, and Control modes, injects a renewed sense of strategy and unpredictability. The addition of talent trees for each hero enables players to customize their playstyle, fostering a deeper connection between players and their chosen heroes. This level of customization adds layers of complexity to team compositions and strategies, resulting in exhilarating matches that are as dynamic as they are strategic.

What's truly impressive is how Blizzard has managed to balance these new features while preserving the game's core essence of teamwork and coordination. Overwatch has always been known for its emphasis on team synergy, and Overwatch 2 takes this concept to new heights. The introduction of shared story missions not only provides a refreshing single-player or cooperative experience but also deepens the lore and emotional connection players have with the heroes they love.

Blizzard's commitment to fostering a vibrant and inclusive community remains evident in Overwatch 2. The revamped social features, including enhanced group finders and an expanded Workshop, make it easier than ever to connect with like-minded players. The dedication to promoting fair play and reducing toxicity shines through the refined reporting and punishment systems, fostering an environment where players can truly enjoy the game to its fullest.

In conclusion, Overwatch 2 is a triumph that showcases Blizzard Entertainment's dedication to their fanbase and their craft. With its stunning visuals, evolved gameplay mechanics, and unwavering commitment to fostering a positive community, Overwatch 2 has set a new standard for what a sequel can achieve. This is not just a game; it's an experience that will captivate both veterans and newcomers for years to come.

Overwatch was a team based hero shooter that took what tf2 did and reinvented it making it the one true rival to tf2 that it was a few years ago
But we are not here to talk about Overwatch
Overwatch 2 is less than Overwatch
skins cost more and are harder to get
balance has been the worst it has ever been since they removed the second tank from your team meaning the tank has alot more to do with alot less room for mistakes
new characters are overpowered and locked behind grinding so you cant even use them for a few days unless you pay for the battlepass
the battlepass is horrible and bloated with useless garbage that nobody wants and most of the good stuff is locked behind weeks of grinding even if you pay upfront

I payed for Overwatch because i actually thought it was worth a shot
it was worth the price i payed
so is Overwatch 2
its worth every penny you pay to play it right now
PvP is good, yes skins are overpriced just don't buy them, yes PVE is overpriced don't buy it, if no one buys the 20$ skins they will have to lower the price.
